Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of squatting or crawling youth, probably Harpocrates. Wearing a hood. Both his hands are down, suggesting he is crawling. Mould-made and hollow with a circular vent hole in the crudely made back. Thick white coating, with possible traces of pink paint (?). Red-brown Nile silt fabric, with abundant mica and dark grey areas from over-firing.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.021) (Phase 3)
